data.title: Toto and Cleopatra (1963)
data.meta_description: Mark Antony has a brother-lookalike, Totonno, a sinister slave trader. Totonno secretly replaces Mark Antony in the most delicate moments.
data.text: Totò is an Italian comedic actor who's been in over a hundred films, though I've only seen him in one (The Witches, 1967). He's got a face kind of like Buster Keaton. In Toto and Cleopatra, however, his comedy calls to mind Phil Silvers with maybe touches of Benny Hill and Rodney Dangerfield. Totò plays Marc Antony and also Antony's shifty twin brother, though there really isn't much difference between the two characters. Often the only way to tell the two apart is by the color of their togas. The brothers take turns romancing three beauties: Cleaopatra (Magali Noël), Octavia (Moira Orfei), and Fulvia (Lia Zoppeli). The humor consists of a lot of rapid-fire shouting, almost too fast for the…
